title: Super compressed sans from classic SILENCE=DEATH poster
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140802222920im_/http:/typophile.com/files/silencedeath2.gif)

Anyone know what this super-compressed sans is? Similar to Gill Display Compressed or as if someone had squeezed Futura Condensed...!  
thanks as ever for your expertise and help!

M

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [silencedeath.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140802222920/http:/typophile.com/files/silencedeath.jpg) | 67.98 KB |
| [silencedeath2.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20140802222920/http:/typophile.com/files/silencedeath2.gif) | 89.89 KB |
author: mvor

comments.content: I can only confirm what you've already found by yourself. Looks like gill sans extra condensed bold to me.
Yes, that is Gill Sans Extra Condensed Bold.

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140802222920im_/http:/typophile.com/files/silencedeath_ex_5021.gif)

You can see that if it is Gill, it has been heavily compressed further, and even then it isn't exactly the same as Gill. So perhaps edited/squashed Gill rather than another font?
[Dude, you have to look at what people tell you to look at.](http://web.archive.org/web/20140802222920/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/gill-sans/bold-extra-condensed/)

Jan, I stand corrected — my font actually called Display Compressed...

thanks!
